text: Johanna Mary Sheehy Skeffington (née Sheehy; 24 May 1877 – 20 April 1946) was a leading suffragette in Dublin, Ireland. She was a teacher, activist, politician, author and editor. She was sent to prison many times for vandalizing buildings for women's votes in Ireland. title: Hanna Sheehy Skeffington
